nodes.label: {'changeType': 'Add', 'type': 'object', 'className': 'EAnnotation', 'attributes': {'id': '_fX3gMt6tEei97MD7GK1RmA', 'source':'An architecture context is a method for customizing Papyrus for a given domain. It defines a regime for editing a Papyrus model semantically and notationally. The semantic editing is defined by a set ','eModelElement':'architecture','references':['architecture']}}

{'changeType': 'Preserve', 'type': 'object', 'className': 'EPackage', 'attributes': {'id': '_fWEwct6tEei97MD7GK1RmA', 'eAnnotations':['org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EAnnotationImpl@62e0a5a6 (source: An architecture context is a method for customizing Papyrus for a given domain. It defines a regime for editing a Papyrus model semantically and notationally. The semantic editing is defined by a set of element type set configurations (from some domain), while the notational side is defined by a set of viewpoints consisting of a set of representation kinds (e.g., diagram kinds and table kinds) and other notational configurations.

An architecture context is composed within an architecture domain (a namespace) and satisfies a set of concerns that belong to a set of stakeholders, both of which are composed in (the same or another) architecture domain. An architecture domain can be specified by one or more architecture models. In the latter case, all of these models are dynamically merged at runtime.

An architecture context can either be an architecture description language or an architecture framework. In the former case, it can own its own set of representation kinds, while in the latter, it cannot. However, in both cases, a context can own a set of viewpoints that reference representation kinds owned by any description language.

Each model in Papyrus is created using a specific architecture context, although this context may later be switched, possibly resulting in the model details being changed. A model also specifies a subset of its context's viewpoints as enabled at creation time, although this set may later be switched as well. When a viewpoint is enabled on a model, a user can create representations, based on this viewpoint's referenced representation kinds, and see them in model explorer. When a viewpoint is disabled, its representations become invisible, unless another enabled viewpoint references their representation kinds.)'],'name':'architecture','nsURI':'http://www.eclipse.org/papyrus/infra/core/architecture','nsPrefix':'architecture','eFactoryInstance':'org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EFactoryImpl@77d2c8e','eClassifiers':['ADElement','ArchitectureDomain','ArchitectureDescriptionLanguage','Stakeholder','Concern','ArchitectureViewpoint','RepresentationKind','ArchitectureContext','ArchitectureFramework','ArchitectureDescription','...']}}

{'changeType': 'Add', 'type': 'object', 'className': 'EAnnotation', 'attributes': {'id': '_fX3gP96tEei97MD7GK1RmA', 'source':'A domain is the root of the architecture model. {'changeType': 'Add', 'type': 'object', 'className': 'EAnnotation', 'attributes': {'id': '_fX3gRN6tEei97MD7GK1RmA', 'source':'A description language (from ISO 42010) represents in Papyrus a modeling language (e.g., UML, SysML). It has a unique id' that corresponds to that of an ''IClientContext from GMF. It references a meta','eModelElement':'ArchitectureDescriptionLanguage','references':['ArchitectureDescriptionLanguage']}}

{'changeType': 'Preserve', 'type': 'object', 'className': 'EClass', 'attributes': {'id': '_fWEwft6tEei97MD7GK1RmA', 'eAnnotations':['org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EAnnotationImpl@4afe429f (source: A description language (from ISO 42010) represents in Papyrus a modeling language (e.g., UML, SysML). It has a unique id' that corresponds to that of an ''IClientContext from GMF. It references a metamodel, a set of profiles, a set of element type set configurations, a creation command (creates a model of this language), a conversion command (converts a model to this language), and and icon. It also has an optional extension prefix for its models. It can also contain a set of representation kinds (which can be either diagrams or tables) and a set of viewpoints.)'],'name':'ArchitectureDescriptionLanguage','ePackage':'architecture','abstract':'false','interface':'false','eStructuralFeatures':['representationKinds','metamodel','profiles'],'eGenericSuperTypes':['org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.EGenericTypeImpl@327fd2e6 (expression: ArchitectureContext)']}}
